alert.note: Alert for Barbour (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 6:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Barbour County through 730 PM CDT... At 646 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spring Hill, or 8 miles southeast of Hurtsboro, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eufaula, Clayton, Hawkinsville, Osco, Spring Hill, Gaino, White Oak, Comer, Lugo, Baker Hill and Batesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
